intro: Lysimachia volkovae, commonly known as the Volkov's chickweed, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. It is a perennial herb that spreads via rhizomes, forming dense mats on the ground. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Lysimachia volkovae is considered a rare and endangered species.
